qsmp.subtitle: Design an informative website reflecting the atmosphere of the QSMP Minecraft server

context.title: Context
context.description1: QSMP is a multiplayer Minecraft server, created by the content creator <creator>Quackity</creator>, which brings together streamers from all over the world, speaking different languages, thanks to a real-time translation system.
context.description2: Their QSMP.co website was designed to bring together all the server's main information: online streamers, a countdown to the next server event, the list of members and their various social networks.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: Quackity's team commissioned me to design the entire showcase site, from visual identity to final interface. I also had the opportunity to interact with the developer throughout the production phase to ensure consistency between the mock-ups and the final product.

qsmp_shop.subtitle: Showcasing the first QSMP figurine collection on an online store

context.title: Context
context.description1: QSMP is a multiplayer Minecraft server, created by the content creator <creator>Quackity</creator>, which brings together streamers from all over the world, speaking different languages, thanks to a real-time translation system.
context.description2: <shop>QSMP.shop</shop> is the QSMP e-commerce site, selling merchandise related to the project. Unfortunately, this design was never put online, but it was nevertheless finalized.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: I was commissioned to design an entire Shopify site dedicated to the first collection of figurines inspired by the series' characters. As each character has a unique identity and story, I took care to reflect their uniqueness through the product cards and details pages.

buddy.subtitle: Create a friendly mascot to embody a data access chatbot

context.title: Context
context.description: Data Supermarket is a tool developed by Carrefour to simplify access to business data via a structured catalog. It integrates a chatbot that allows users to obtain information by interacting directly with it.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description1: I was asked to design an illustration and give a visual identity to this chatbot. The aim was to move away from the codes of classic call assistants, adopting a more informal, youthful and friendly approach, in line with the interface already designed.
contribution.description2: To create these illustrations, I was inspired by the emotional palette of Apple's Memoji, while integrating Carrefour's emblematic colors, blue and red, as well as the pastel hues of the Data Supermarket interface.

context.title: Context
context.description1: Totoro is an application designed to encourage local exchanges and re-energize community life.
context.description2: As a reward for completing a local mission, users earn tokens that can then be exchanged for discount vouchers to be used at local retailers.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description1: During this project, I had the opportunity to create the visual identity. Together with the second designer, I also co-constructed the user path, a design kit and all the mobile app's screens.

bescherelle.subtitle: Rethinking a mobile application into a web solution

context.title: Context
context.description1: Mon Coach Bescherelle is a spelling and writing training tool created by Hatier.
context.description2: Its main problem was its accessibility. The tool was only available as a smartphone application. My mission was therefore to make it available on the Educadhoc educational platform, while taking into account the constraints imposed by its layout.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: After analyzing all the contents of the mobile application and the various possibilities of the Educadhoc platform, I was able to start iterating on the required interfaces, through feedback from the internal teams, all the way through to this final version.

context.title: Context
context.description: La Grande Conversation is an exhibition based on 21 people interviewed about their lives and various artists' works (photographs, sculptures, installations, drawings and paintings...). Maison Laurentine's request is to allow visitors to grow out of this exhibition and be less afraid of entering into conversation with others.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: During this project, I took part in the ideation and definition of user journeys with my entire team. I was then in charge of designing the interactive terminal’s interfaces.

proposal.title: Our proposal
proposal.description1: To enhance the visitor experience, we suggested the idea of an interactive logbook. Its main aim is to make art more playful and accessible to all, by allowing complete personalization. Throughout their journey, visitors can record their impressions, add notes and create a unique souvenir of the exhibition.
proposal.description2: In addition, this logbook also acts as an orientation tool, facilitating navigation between the various spaces thanks to an interactive map and a geolocation function. An intuitive and immersive way to explore the exhibition, while keeping a personal record of your visit.

1.description: As soon as I enter the exhibition, I come across a stand presenting the logbook experience, where I'm invited to pick up an NFC card.

2.description: I pick up one and begin my tour of the Maison Laurentine. Once in front of a piece of art, I scan my card on the associated terminal.

3.description: I discover a blank digital notebook with various personalization options (texts, photos, drawings). It contains elements linked to the artwork, such as a photo, the artist's signature or portrait.

4.description: Once I've filled in a few pages at the various terminals, I scan my card with my phone to consult the pieces I've discovered and track the progress of my exploration journal.

5.description: At the end of my visit, thanks to the unique code on my NFC card, I can share my experience with friends and family by showing them the map of my journey, available on the website.

ths_tracker.subtitle: Developing an all-in-one tool to support transgender people's journey

context.title: Context
context.description: In 2023, I witnessed a wave of requests from transgender people on Twitter for a tool that would make it easier to track hormone intake. With this in mind, a developer friend and I decided to work on a tool to address this need.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: This project is still ongoing. We have begun to create a user journey and wireframes based on the results of a quantitative survey. These screens, once completed, will then be tested by potential users during interviews.

research.title: User research
research.intro: After conducting a survey of over 170 people, we identified the key needs of our future users.

needs.symptoms: Monitor the evolution of their symptoms and moods
needs.reminders: Have a reminder of their hormone intake

architecture.intro: Based on this data, I identified the essential functionalities to be included in V1 and drew up an initial architecture for the application, <link>which can be accessed at this link</link>.
architecture.sections_intro: It is structured around the following main sections.

tracking.title: My tracking
tracking.description: Get an overview of my upcoming reminders and hormone levels.

journal.title: Journal
journal.description: Record my current symptoms and moods, as well as personal notes.

reminders.title: Reminders
reminders.description: Create and edit reminders with a wide range of customization options.

collection_zoologie.subtitle: Bringing together transmission and discussion around the Anthropocene

context.title: Context
context.description1: The Zoology Collection of Santiago Aragon is a unique scientific heritage, bringing together several thousand specimens, including naturalized animals and historical anatomical pieces.
context.description2: The aim of this project was to enhance the value of this collection through an immersive and educational approach, facilitating its access to the general public and students. Using digital tools, the project aimed to modernize the transmission of knowledge, while preserving the scientific and cultural heritage of this collection.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.description: For this project, my role was more focused on ideating and defining solutions, as well as thinking about user journeys.

study.title: analysis of the context and challenges
study.description1: After talking to Santiago Aragon and visiting the collection, we identified a number of challenges concerning the Zoological Collection. Its narrative approach, centered on the individual history of each specimen, offers an immersive and empathetic experience, rare in traditional museums.
study.description2: Santiago also wants to use the collection to open up discussions on the Anthropocene, extending beyond its simple scientific role. However, its location within the university limits its visibility and recognition.
study.description3: The absence of written information, compensated for by direct interaction with the owner, raises the question of the transmission of knowledge. Lastly, its key role in the visitor experience underlines the need to preserve and perpetuate his impact on the collection.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: The collection suffers from a lack of visibility, with no on-site signage and no real online presence, making it difficult to access. Nor does it have its own identifiable identity.

scenography.title: Scenography
scenography.description: The scenography is uneven: some items are highlighted while others remain hidden. The absence of informative labels complicates the visit, especially for the uninitiated.

information.title: Informations
information.description: Santiago Aragon is central to the transmission of knowledge, making the collection dependent on his presence. Ensuring the continuity of his expertise and providing minimum access to specimen information could enrich the visitor experience.

solutions.title: Suggestions of solutions
solutions.solution1: Creating a visual identity for the collection
solutions.solution2: Create a scientific and cultural database of all specimens
solutions.solution3: Create a smartphone-readable digital label for each specimen
solutions.solution4: Create a timeline to organize heritage information and position it within the context of the Anthropocene
solutions.solution6: Show contact information by the door
solutions.solution7: Create a signage system within the University

zoologie.title: Collection de Zoologie de Sorbonne Université
zoologie.subtitle: Bringing together transmission and discussion around the Anthropocene
